chapter.title: Metadata Repository
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to operate with Murano Metadata Repository via UI.

Metadata Repository is a REST API server that stores all data necessary for a service deployment. Information about service and it's dependencies called service definition or manifest. Murano Conductor and Dashboard will load information about services via service definition and service or application will be available for creation. Besides manifests Murano Repository stores this types of data:
ui UI definitions for Murano dashboard
workflows set of rules for Murano Conductor
heat templates for spawning instance with Heat
agent Murano Agent templates
scripts Murano Execution Plans
In "Murano" tab go to the Service Definitions panel:

From this view you have opportunity to perform this actions:
Compose Service provides a form for creation new service manifest. After this operation new service will appears in Service Definitions table and you will be allowed to download this service definition, modify or delete it.
Upload Service provides a form for uploading tar.gz archive with already composed service manifest and other dependency files.
Manage Files button will redirect you to a view where you can manipulate with all files stored in Metadata Repository: download, delete and upload new.
Toggle Enabled button will make service active or inactive depending on the current state.
Modify Service gives you opportunity to add or delete information from service definition.
Manage Service redirects you to a view with information about selected service and service files for all data types that Murano Repository supports. From here you can upload file and add it to service dependency in one click.
Download Service saves archive with all files used by specified service.
Delete Service removes service manifest and all dependencies that are not used by other services from Murano Repository server.

section.title: Compose Service
section.para:
Let's review service creation in details. After clicking on "Compose Service" button from "Service Definitions" view you'll see the following form:
It consists of several tabs. On the first tab you need to fill up general information about service:
Service Name
Specify a name for a service.
Fully Qualified Service Name
Specify an internal service name. It should be unique and can contain only alphanumeric symbols and dots.
Version
Specify version of service definition.
Active
If checkbox is enabled service will be available for clients and can be created. If you are creating service that is not ready for a deployment you can set checkbox value to false.
Description
Add text information about service. This information will appear in service creation form in Murano Dashboard.
Go to the next tab and select one of UI definition you want to use for this service. You can upload new definition in Manage Files view.
All other tabs correspond to data types. Navigate to desired tab and select files for service dependency.

section.title: Manage Files
section.para:
Murano Repository table shows all files stored in Metadata Repository. Files are divided into groups by data types. Group name contains number in brackets which defines quantity of files belong to that group. Click on the type name to browse all files of this type.
Available actions:
Download file;
Delete file;
Upload file.
To upload file to repository you need to fill up this form:
Murano Repository File
Select file for uploading. It should be not bigger than 5Mb.
File Type
Select one of supported type. It will be loaded directly to a directory that stores corresponding file types.
